DOC.brief_title: Bipolar Versus Monopolar Resection Benign Prostate Hyperplasia
DOC.detailed_description: Background Purpose : Aim prospective clinical study compare two different surgical technique use solution serum electrolyte , bleed Transurethral Resection Prostate ( TURP ) syndrome undergoing TURP . Methods : Fifty-three patient schedule elective TURP enrol prospective clinical study . Patients divide two group . Patients Group M ( Monopolar ) ( n=25 ) use monopolar resectoscope ( Karl Storz , Tottling , Germany ) 5 % mannitol irrigate solution . Patients Group B ( Bipolar ) ( n=25 ) use bipolar resectoscope TURis ( OLYMPUS , Tokyo , Japan ) isotonic saline irrigating solution . Patients receive spinal anaesthesia give 2.5-3 ml 0.5 % hyperbaric bupivacain intrathecally others give general anaesthesia . Patients demographic , prostate volume , hemodynamic parameter , volume irrigation IV solution record . Blood sample collect preoperatively ( control ) , 45 minute induction ( 2nd Measurement ) 1 hour end operation analyze serum electrolyte , osmolarity , hemoglobin value .
